11.15.16  11:46 am   From all previous indications it seems as though you spend a very significant amount of time creating, and spend very little time consuming things others have created. Do you think that has influenced the way you create things, or that allowing yourself to consume more things would influence the way you create things? And do you do this because you don't enjoy consuming things, or because you want to spend more of your limited time on creating things? (Things meaning videos, songs, images, stories, and the suchlike.)

     i am on a 2 step program. step one is consume as many different types of content as possible, for many years, and get more and more enriched while also becoming more and more sad and jealous, wanting more and more desperately to create your own content, knowing and hoping in the future that some day the whole thing will flip around and you will be making mad content regularly. step 2 is when it actually does flip around and you start actually doing the content. currently on step 2

html: 1.13.18  8:01 pm   People ask you how to get motivated to do stuff, and you often ask them why they have to do the thing. It seems simple - "just answer the question, and that answer is the thing that motivates you" - but that's not the problem. I know why I need to do it. I know that doing the thing, whatever it is, is the most logically, emotionally, and/or spiritually satifying thing I can do right now, the thing I'll look back on and say "I'm glad I did that thing." It is the best thing to do in every regard, except one: doing the thing will make the right now go from being okay to feeling sucky, and that just sets the rest of my brain in a tizzy, and I try to fight against it but my inner fatass always wins. So, Bill Wurtz, I ask you, how do I garner the mental power to stop my griping and groaning and just do the sucky thing already?
original_html: 1.13.18  8:01 pm   People ask you how to get motivated to do stuff, and you often ask them why they have to do the thing. I know that doing the thing, whatever it is, is the most logically, emotionally, and/or spiritually satifying thing I can do right now, the thing I'll look back on and say "I'm glad I did that thing." It is the best thing to do in every regard, except one: doing the thing will make the right now go from being okay to feeling sucky, and that just sets the rest of my brain in a tizzy, and I try to fight against it but my inner fatass always wins. So, Bill Wurtz, I ask you, how do I garner the mental power to stop my griping and groaning and just do the sucky thing already?

html: 1.13.18  7:51 pm   if something is your favorite, that means that it is the thing you prefer. it does not mean that that thing is better than the other things, it's just the one that you prefer. for example, my favorite fruit is the apple. if I walk into a fruit store and the shopkeeper asks me what I would like, I would say "give me an apple, please". perhaps the next person in line might prefer a grapefruit, or a plum, or a banana.. and that is just fine. but I would prefer an apple over a grapefruit, plum, or banana. that doesn't mean that the apple is better than those fruits.... that being said.... what is your favorite band?
